AFA Mobile Field Application aids in conducting surveys and field inspections. Its integrated to AFA IMIS. The Authority is the successor of former regulatory institutions in the sector that were merged into Directorates under the Authority, with the commencement of Crops Act, 2013 on 1st August 2014 , including Coffee Board of Kenya, Kenya Sugar Board, Tea Board of Kenya, Coconut Development Authority, Cotton Development Authority, Sisal Board of Kenya, Pyrethrum Board of Kenya, Horticultural Crops Development Authority.
The Agriculture and Food Authority (AFA) is a state corporation established through an Act of Parliament specifically, under section 3 of the Agriculture, Fisheries and Food Authority Act of 2013.\n\n Vision: \n To be a World Class Regulator in the Agriculture Sector \n\n Mission: \n To sustainably develop and promote scheduled crops value chains through effective regulation for economic growth \n\n Core values: \n The Authority is committed to excellent service delivery based of the following core values: \n\t Professionalism \n\t Integrity \n\t Customer focus \n\t Teamwork \n\t Innovativeness \n\nMotto: \n Our crops our wealth

Is the nursery site accessible Is there a clearance letter from a supplier of planting materials Does the personnel demonstrate adequate knowledge in nursery management For an existing crop, what is the age of the crop Is the source of planting materials seed/Clonal Does the crop have phenotypic characteristics – Distinctiveness, Uniformity Are there disease incidences of Fusarium Wilt Budding disease Are there pest incidences of Thrips, red spider mites, nematodes, moles Are field hygiene conditions satisfactory Has a target market been identified Has an inspection by Kephis, a site inspection, a water test, etc been carried out Recommendations Certificate Number Pyrethrum Inspection Checklist Pyrethrum Inspection Details Pyrethrum Inspection List Tea WareHouseMan Inspection Tea WarehouseMan Inspection Checklist Mandatory(5 marks) Is there a certificate of company registration/incorporation Is there a valid insurance policy in place Is the hygiene policy documented Must(2 marks) Is there any evidence of implementation of the hygiene policy Has food safety hazard risk assessment been done Must (3 marks) Are there control measures for potential food safety contaminantsvin place Are glass policies and glass inspections documented Are there valid medical certificates Are hygiene trainings conducted Are there adequate and clean personal protective equipment (ppe\'s) Are personnel hygiene practices followed Are changing rooms and toilets adequate and clean Are cleaning programs for plant and equipment documented Recommended(1 mark) Are cleaning records kept Are cleaning detergents segregated and labeled Are all pests exterminated Is the bait map up to date Are inspections done at least every 3 months Are there precautions put in place to prevent possible contamination Is storage, distribution and transportation carried out without product damage Do walls and partitions have at least 0.5m passageway all round Is there a procedure for inspection of incoming and outgoing products Are materials properly segregated Is there adequate security/ access control to storage and processing areas Is there sufficient ventilation (e.g. use of extractor fans) Are services adequately provided: (water, air, lighting, power, etc) Is proper collection, storage and disposal of waste carried out Does the external site(grounds) meet required standards Must (1 mark) Do the walls meet the required standards Do the floors meet the required standards Does the roof/ceiling and overhead meet the required standards Do the windows meet the required standards Do the doors meet the required standards Are light tubes/bulbs protected Are maintenance programs in place Are maintenance records maintained Are conveyor belts with unpacked tea protected Is product testing carried out Are weighing scales correctly calibrated Medical examination Are incoming product/vehicle inspections done Are hygiene/housekeeping inspections done Are annual returns submitted License Number Authority to Erect Number Coffee Area Production Record of Past 3 years (in Kgs) Crop Husbandry Practices on the Farm Total Land Area (acres) Total Number of Trees Area Under Mature Coffee (acres) Production(Kg) Is there an objection letter from its mother society Environmental Management Coffee Advisory Officer Recommendations Coffee Working Group directorate licence valid Has a single business permit by the county been issued ASPECTS - Tick for(Yes) Are waste disposal systems in place Has the fire fighting equipment been serviced Is general hygiene satisfactory Are washing rooms clean Is clean water supplied Is electricity supplied Are returns to coffee directorate remitted Are traceability systems in place Are cupping facilities for coffee quality analysis in place Is the Occupational and Health Act certification valid Is payment to growers within max of 14 days after an auction done Are Standard out turn sales statements in place Are Standard Direct sales Contracts in place Quality Analysis Facility Are offices/premises ideal Are fire fighting equipment in place Is clean water available Is sample roaster in place Is sample grinder in place Are spitting drums in place Are testing cups in place Are sample trays in place Are spoons in place Is there a water heating system in place Is there a moisture meter in place Are washing rooms satisfactory Is the licensed liquorer hired Are environmental sustainability efforts in place Is value addition (roasting) undertaken Does the packaging quality meet the required standards Physical Facilities Transporting Firm/Company Name Own Farm Contracted Sources Is transportation of produce done in a manner that avoids mechanical damage to the transport vessel Are the transport vessels cleaned and disinfected regulary Are documentations cleared or are there temporary control systems Is the intergrity of product consignment ensured by the operators Is the produce handling facility approved by HCD regional offices Any Other Comments Dealer Category Is there a certification to KS1758 Award* Corrective measures timeline* Remarks* Are there other recognized standards Is there evidence of registration on the national traceability system Is there evidence of registration on the Single Window System Is there evidence of safe disposal of farm waste and pollution control Is there evidence of protection of worker’s welfare Is there a copy of HCD Export License (validity renewals) Is there a traceability list of the company’s contracted farmers/scheme Are Marketing Agents (Suppliers) declared with furnished certificates Is there evidence of a traceability system policy and procedure (QMS) Is there any evidence of attendance of annual training on KS1758 part 2 b Is there an annual training matrix/schedule for staff, suppliers Is there any evidence of pest and disease control procedures Are there claims against non payment by contracted farmers Are HCD registered clearing Agents utilized Approval Stage Area Under Coffee (acres) Pulping Machine Type Market Prices Location Sub Location Product Brand Name Quantity (MT) Price Market Outlet Is Adhoc Inspection Produce Source(tick appropriately) Exporter own farm ID No Is there a valid certification to GAP Are contracts duly signed and witnessed Is there a production plan per crop per month(for 3months) Is the exporter aware of the market requirements Does the exporter have trained personnel Are there controlled and approved traceability procedures in place Does the expoter have petcide MRL for the intended product Are field codes/blocks/labels in place Is planting date and crop planted recorded Certification to GAP (Valid certificate) Contract With Exporter Knowledge of Market Requirements Farm/Farmer Reference Codes Records Approved Chemical List Pesticide Spray Record Is the chemical list approved and valid Does the exporter have an approved spray program Are there product invoices and receipts against spray program Are there spray records/pesticide records Is the tradename of the product recorded Is the PHI recorded Are all spraying dates indicated Is the amount of pesticide applied recorded Is the PHI observed Field Produce Handling Facility Pesticide Application Personnel Are there training schedules and certificates Is there pest management protocol for pests Is there any evidence on scounting of pests Is there any evidence of control of pests Is there a collection shed for the farmers Is the collection and sorting shed secured Is there an appropriate hygiene instructions collection/sorting facility Are grading tables made of food grade materials Does the shed have running water for washing hands Is there a toilet at the facility Is there a PPE for graders at the shed Is there a storage area for the graded products Structure Of Collection Shed Management Of Produce Collection Product Identification Records Farmer Training On GAP Technical Support Comments Is the collection shed accessible to all buyers and farmers Does the collection area have an office Is the collection shed made of easy to clean and disinfect material Is there adequate lighting/ventilation Is there a waste disposal facility Is there a register of all incoming produce at the shed Are there procedures for product handling Are the personnel handling the produce trained on food security Are all farmers registered at the produce collection centres Are there traceability codes accompanying the produce Is there a of register for all produce leaving the farm Does the farmer have training certificates Is there any evidence of technical support to farmers by the exporter Any Other Comment Latex Stains Skin Color Flesh Color Skin Defects Stalk Presence
